metadata.title: Paragnetina lacrimosa Klapalek 1921
metadata.description:
Paragnetina lacrimosa Klapálek, 1921

Paragnetina lacrimosa Klapálek, 1921: 62.

Paragnetina lacrimosa: Wu, 1938: 81, Fig. 75, Fig. 2;

Paragnetina lacrimosa: Claassen, 1940: 130, catalog;

Paragnetina lacrimosa: Illies, 1966: 281, 284, catalog;

Paragnetina lacrimosa: Kimmins, 1970: 344, checklist;

Paragnetina lacrimosa: Sivec et al., 1988: 20, 23, Fig. 8;

Paragnetina lacrimosa: Du, 1999: 307, Fig. 25-6;

Paragnetina lacrimosa: Du et al., 1999: 61, checklist;

Paragnetina lacrimosa: Yang & Li, 2018: 33, catalog.

Examined material. 1 male (USNM), labeled “ Fukien, South China, Cha-go-hui, Kien-yang District, May 10-18, 1933, D. C. Ngu and “ Paragnetina lacrimosa Det. B. Stark 2008 ”.

Distribution. Fujian of China.

Remarks. The holotype is from “Kualun, N.W. Fokien” (Klapálek, 1921), and the present male is from Jianyang District of Nanping City, apparently not the holotype. Sivec et al. (1988) provided excellent illustrations of both genders of the species, but did not mention the collection data of the specimens. The male we examined agrees well with their illustrations, indicating they may refer to the same male. However, we did not find the co-occurred female illustrated by Sivec et al., (1988).

journal.title: A new synonym of Paragnetina flavotincta (McLachlan, 1872) (Plecoptera: Perlidae) with notes on Paragnetina lacrimosa Klapálek, 1921, pp. 137-141 in Zootaxa

metadata.notes: Published as part of Li, Hanyu, Li, Weihai, Kong, Fanbin & Teslenko, Valentina A., 2025, A new synonym of Paragnetina flavotincta (McLachlan, 1872) (Plecoptera: Perlidae) with notes on Paragnetina lacrimosa Klapálek, 1921, pp. 137-141 in Zootaxa 5661 (1) on page 138, DOI: 10.11646/zootaxa.5661.1.9, http://zenodo.org/record/16604524

metadata.title: Paragnetina flavotincta
metadata.description:
Paragnetina flavotincta (McLachlan, 1872)

(Figs. 1−2)

Perla flavotincta McLachlan, 1872: 54, pl. 1, Fig. 9;

Paragnetina ocellata Klapálek, 1921: 61, syn. nov. in Zwick, 1973: 153, Figs. 7‒10;

Paragnetina flavotincta: Zhiltzova, 1967: 852, Figs. 8‒9;

Paragnetina flavotincta: Kimmins, 1970: 342;

Paragnetina flavotincta: Zhiltsova & Teslenko, 1988: 14, Figs.1 −8;

Paragnetina flavotincta: Zhu, Zhang & Wang, 2006: 548, Fig. 2;

Paragnetina flavotincta: Surenkhorloo, 2009: 710;

Paragnetina flavotincta: Judson & Nelson, 2012: 38, Figs. 224−227;

Paragnetina flavotincta: Teslenko, 2024: 109, Figs. 76−82.

Paragnetina neimongolica Yang & Yang, 1996: 115, Fig. 1. syn. nov.

Material examined. Holotype male (CAU): CHINA, Inner Mongolia, Xing’an League, 1983.VII.13, leg. Long Zhang.

Additional materials: 1 female, China, Jilin Province, Antu County, Songjiang River before Baixi hotel, 42.0564° N, 127.5983° E, 9.VII.2015, leg. Zehui Kang; 1 male and 1 female, Russia, Amurskaya Oblast, Amur R. Basin, Kasatkino village, Ganukan River, mouth, 48.95639° N 130.12199° E, 13.08.2003, leg. T. Tiunova.

Distribution. This species is widespread in the Eastern Palearctic. It occurs in China (Inner Mongolia, Jilin Province, Xinjiang), the Korean Peninsula, Mongolia, and in Russia (East Siberia and south of the Far East).

Remarks. Yang & Yang (1996) did not evert the aedeagus of P. neimongolica Yang & Yang, 1996 in the original species description. They merely noted that it is externally similar to P. indentata Wu & Claassen, 1934. Upon examination of the holotype, the dissected penis of P. neimongolica was almost indistinguishable from that of P. flavotincta (Figs. 1, 2). Some minor differences were noted in the shape of the apex in the anterior hemitergal process on tergum 10 (Fig. 1b, Fig. 2c) and the fork of the penial tube lobes of both species (Fig. 1 c-e, Fig. 2 d-e). We considered both species conspecific with P. neimongolica being regarded as a subjective junior synonym of P. flavotincta (McLachlan, 1872) syn. nov.
